Package com.github.oeuvres.alix.lucene.search

Class FieldFacet

java.lang.Object
com.github.oeuvres.alix.lucene.search.FieldFacet
public class FieldFacet extends Object
A dedicated dictionary for stats on facets. This class is lighter than the lucene facet package, backed to memory only, and allow more complex scoring.

Example scenario: search "science God" among lots of books. Which author should be the more relevant result? The one with the more occurrences could be a good candidate, but if he signed lots of big books in the corpus, he has a high probability to use the searched words. Different formulas are known for such scoring.

Different variables could be used in such formulas. Some are only relative to all index, some are cacheable for each facet value, other are search dependent.

  • index, total document count
  • index, total occurrences count
  • facet, total document count
  • facet, total occurrences count
  • search, matching document count
  • search, matching occurrences count

This facet dic is backed on an efficient BytesRefHash. This handy data structure provide a sequential int id for each term. This is used as a pointer in different growing arrays. On creation, object is populated with data non dependent of a search. Those internal vectors are stored as arrays with facetId index.

    • forms

      public FormEnum forms(FieldText ftext, org.apache.lucene.util.BitSet docFilter) throws IOException
      Get occurences stats by facet from a text field.
      Parameters:
      ftext - required stats from a text field.
      docFilter - optional set of internal lucene docId.
      Returns:
      an enumerator of facets with some textual stats.
      Throws:
      IOException - Lucene errors.

    • forms

      public FormEnum forms(FieldText ftext, String[] search, org.apache.lucene.util.BitSet docFilter, OptionDistrib distrib) throws IOException
      Get occurrences count of a text field by facet. For example, an index has 3 facets : withLotsOfDummy, withSomeDummy, withoutDummy. Searching for the word "dummy" may result in a count of occurrences of the word "dummy" very different on each facet (withLotsOfDummy: a lot, withSomeDummy: some, withoutDummy: 0). Query maybe restricted by a doc filter (a corpus). If there are no search in the search, will cry. Returns an iterator on search of this facet, with scores and other stats.
      Parameters:
      ftext - required stats from a text field.
      search - required set of terms present in the text field.
      docFilter - optional set of internal lucene docId.
      distrib - optional distribution to calculate a score for each facet.
      Returns:
      an enumerator of facets with textual stats.
      Throws:
      IOException - Lucene errors.

    • nos

      public int[] nos(org.apache.lucene.search.TopDocs topDocs)
      Use a list of search as a navigator for a list of doc ids. The list is supposed to be sorted in a relevant order for this facet ex : (author, title) or (author, date) for an author facet. Get the index of the first relevant document for each faceted term.
      Parameters:
      topDocs - lucene search results IndexSearcher.search(Query, int).
      Returns:
      array[facetId] = docId (the first one in the sort

    • stats

      public long[] stats(FieldText ftext)
      Calculate, by facet, global count of occurrences of a text field
      Parameters:
      ftext - required stats on a text field.
      Returns:
      array[facetId] = count of occurrences of documents.

    • norm

      public static org.apache.lucene.util.BytesRef[] norm(org.apache.lucene.util.BytesRefHash dic, CharSequence[] values)
      Normalize a list of forms to search in an IndexReader. Filter null and forms absent from the dictionary. Initial order is kept (except for duplicates).
      Parameters:
      values - colection of form to test against dictionary.
      Returns:
      set of unique values.

    • maxValue

      public int maxValue()
